testcase.name: US1: As a parts purchaser, I want to see a parts inventory, so that I can see how many parts I have stocked.
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: US1: As a parts purchaser, I want to see a parts inventory, so that I can see how many parts I have stocked. Given a set of specific parts ... skipped in 0.000s | name | description | quantity | | partA | descriptionA | 10 | | partB | descriptionB | 0 | | partC | descriptionC | 0 | Given a bag type "bagtype1" with parts list of ... skipped in 0.000s | name | part | quantity | | A | partA | 1 | | B | partB | 2 | Given a bag type "bagtype2" with parts list of ... skipped in 0.000s | name | part | quantity | | B | partB | 2 | | C | partC | 3 | Given a set of specific bags ... skipped in 0.000s | name | kind | quantity | complete | | AB | bagtype1 | 10 | X | | AB | bagtype2 | 10 | X | Given a kit type "kittype1" with bags list of ... skipped in 0.000s | name | bagtype | quantity | | A | bagtype1 | 1 | | B | bagtype2 | 2 | When I read all "part" ... skipped in 0.000s Then the first item should have "name" equal to "partA" ... skipped in 0.000s And the first item should have "quantity" equal to number "10" ... skipped in 0.000s But the last item should have "name" equal to "partC" ... skipped in 0.000s And the last item should have "quantity" equal to number "0" ... skipped in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: US3: As a parts purchaser, I want to see which parts to buy to do a specified number of kits, so that I do not understock nor overstock.
testcase.system-out:
